xxl.core.cursors.sources.io

Class URLInputCursor<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      • xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.InputStreamCursor<E>
        • xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.URLInputCursor<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of the elements read from the URL.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<E>, Cursor<E>

    public class URLInputCursor<E>
extends InputStreamCursor<E>
    This class provides a cursor that depends on a given URL, i.e., the data stored in a ressource specified by a given URL. It iterates over the objects that are read out of the URL's input stream. A converter is used in order to read out the serialized objects. This class implements only a few constructors. These constructers create an new input stream cursor that depends on an input stream for reading from the connection to the given URL.

    Example usage (1): 

       // create a new URLInputIterator with ...
   
   URLInputCursor<KPE> cursor = new URLInputCursor<KPE>(
   
       // a converter for convertable objects
       
       new ConvertableConverter<KPE>(
       
           // a factory method that created KPEs with 2 dimensions
           
           new Function<Object, KPE>() {
               public KPE invoke() {
                   return new KPE(2);
               }
           }
       ),
       
       // a given URL
       
       new URL("http://www.xxl-library.de/rr_small.bin")
   );
   
   // open the cursor
   
   cursor.open();
   
   // print all elements of the cursor
   
   while(cursor.hasNext())
       System.out.println(cursor.next());
       
   // close the cursor
   
   cursor.close();

    See Also:
    Iterator, Cursor, InputStreamCursor

    • Constructor Detail

      • URLInputCursor

        public URLInputCursor(Converter<? extends E> converter,
                      URL url,
                      int bufferSize)
               throws IOException
        Constructs a new URL-input cursor that depends on the specified URL and uses the specified converter in order to read out the serialized objects. An internal buffer of size bufferSize is used for the URL-input.
        Parameters:
        converter - the converter that is used for reading out the serialized objects of this iteration.
        url - the URL that specifies a ressource containing the serialized objects of this iteration.
        bufferSize - the size of the buffer that is used for the URL-input.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • URLInputCursor

        public URLInputCursor(Converter<? extends E> converter,
                      URL url)
               throws IOException
        Constructs a new URL-input cusor that depends on the specified URL and uses the specified converter in order to read out the serialized objects. This constructor is equivalent to the call of 
           new URLInputIterator(converter, url, 4096)
        .
        Parameters:
        converter - the converter that is used for reading out the serialized objects of this iteration.
        url - the URL that contains the serialized objects of this iteration.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
